content:
It's natural to feel nervous about practicing with native speakers, but remember that making mistakes and not understanding everything is a part of the language learning process. Native speakers generally appreciate and admire language learners' efforts to learn and practice their language.

Here are a few tips to help you feel more comfortable when practicing with native speakers:

1. Set realistic expectations: Don't expect to be fluent overnight. Accept that making mistakes is part of the learning process.

2. Focus on the conversation: Don't worry too much about grammar or vocabulary. Stay engaged in the conversation and try to understand the general meaning.

3. Ask questions: Don't hesitate to ask your conversation partner to repeat or rephrase something if you don't understand it.

4. Keep a positive attitude: Language learning can be challenging, but it's also rewarding. Keep a positive and open-minded attitude towards the learning process.

Remember that language exchange is a mutual learning experience. You can also help your conversation partner practice their language skills, even if you're not a native speaker. Enjoy the conversation and have fun practicing!
